comments:
I just updated using the newest dev build 2.0.0v20070330-8000 and my Jira tasks do not synchronize correctly.
E.g. the "Completed" status is not set for any of the task, but the web interface shows some as completed.

Have a look at this stack trace:

Created an attachment (id=62556)
Recreating offline task cache due to format update

This directly appear after the first error in log. Seems to be related.

Created an attachment (id=62560)
Could not restore offline repository tasks file, creating new one, likely cause is format update.

This appeared as I switched back to Mylar 2.0M1.

Not surprising I guess. I will export my task list, re-enable dev build, clear the .mylar directory and re-import the tasks.

- Switched back to Mylar 2.0M1
- Exported complete Task List.
- Reconfigured Eclipse to current dev.
- Stopped Eclipse.
- Deleted .mylar directory.
- Started Eclipse with new dev build enabled.

---> same behaviour

Created an attachment (id=62567)
Stdout exception stack trace

Displayed by Eclipse at standard. Seems to be related since the top level error refers to JIRA server data.

The "Error reading JIRA repository configuration cache" is expected, due to the changes in offline task storage. So, that error is really harmless and we probably shouldn't log the stack trace and change it into the warning.

Also note that server cache is not stored in .mylar folder. It is stored in <workspace>\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.mylar.jira.core\serverCache

Though I am not sure what caused class not found error.

(In reply to comment #5)
> The "Error reading JIRA repository configuration cache" is expected, due to the
> changes in offline task storage. So, that error is really harmless and we
> probably shouldn't log the stack trace and change it into the warning.

OK. I did see a similiar error as I switched back to 2.0M1. But the major difference is:
The JIRA Completed status is synched correctly. This does not work for the dev build
and is the original error I am reporting.

> Also note that server cache is not stored in .mylar folder. It is stored in
> <workspace>\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.mylar.jira.core\serverCache
> Though I am not sure what caused class not found error.

Marking as a duplicate

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 179873 ***
I changed the message to info from error and the text is now: "Reset JIRA repository configuration cache due to format update".
